result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work, school and treatment.
Contact the probation and parole office by 5:00 p.m. on July 22, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00 p.m. on July 22nd, 2022 and pay the DNA sucharge.  
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court waived all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.
Complete a mental health assessment, complete an anger management course and comply with any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel Charles Robinson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve THREE MONTHS the House of Correction with credit for SEVEN DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work, school, and treatment.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on JULY 22ND, 2022.  
Complete a mental health assessment, complete an anger management course, and comply with any recommended treatment.
No contact with NCR.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on JULY 22ND, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.
APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Victim Impact Statement, received and filed
Case rescheduled off the record due to judge unavailability.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Charles Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in Court for Plea/sentencing hearing. Due to technical difficulties, State object to proceed by zoom. State requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request. Defendant is to appear in person at the next court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 30. Plea/sentencing hearing is scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00am.

Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Charles Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Court began plea but did not finish.  Court will adjourn hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 30 - via zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Charles Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Bail Review Hearing.  Defense counsel withdraws requests.  Defense counsel was recently appointed on this case and requests status date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nathaniel C R
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Nathaniel Charles Robinson in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Charles Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
